website_summaries.verdict: The Wake bike stem is simple, inexpensive, colorful, and gets the job done.
cons: Although this bike stem may not be as high quality as some of its competition, it is an excellent deal for the price

customer_reviews.title: Great Stem for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic stem for the money. Unlike some other reviews, I had no issues with the Allen bolts stripping. The only thing to be aware of is that the part of the stem that mounts to the steer tube is fairly thin, so there is a good chance you are going to have to add a headset spacer or cut your steer tube down slightly. I mounted this on my trail bike, which I ride aggressively, including some fairly large drops and jumps. I’ve had it on my bike for about four months, so I don’t think durability is any issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Greatly Improved My Posture and Steering
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I am about 6'1 and ride a Large Frame GT Aggressor Pro. I wanted to sit more upright and improve my posture while riding through trails. This greatly helped decrease the amount of leaning I have to do while riding. If you are tall and have a little discomfort and/or want the added ability of more control over steering please make this easy purchase. Dollar for dollar you will greatly appreciate the change this bike stem will make to your biking experience. Shipping was quick and well packed.
customer_reviews.author: Scotsman83

customer_reviews.title: Tough, inexpensive, and cool looking, I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I still can't believe it. These things are great! Fit perfect, improved handling, have survived several crashes better than I did, and they look good too! Unknowingly, this stem is the same brand as the new handlebars I ordered at the same time. I usually don't care about such things, but this was an added bonus. Really blends in nicely with the rest of my bicycle. I'm reviving an old Gary Fisher mtb, and this has been a very important component to enhanced handling and is aesthetically pleasing. Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Ol'Roy MTB etc.

customer_reviews.title: I got this to accent my bike and it looks awesome. I really haven't used it lot but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't broke it yet. It's lot lighter compared to my original. I got this to accent my bike and it looks awesome. I really haven't used it lot but I ride off trail and I get a lot of bump. so far so good. As you know this is one of the critical part on your bike and I would say I'm confident that it will hold. I will try to abuse it a little bit more when I get the chance . if you don't see an update then its still holding up.
customer_reviews.author: ROLFREEN

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE quality!
customer_reviews.text: Altered review to 1 star. upon fastening the stem, the lower bolt that sits on the fork did eat the thread of the stem with no extra torque applied at all - was fastening it by hand, with no wrench, to sense when it would be getting tight. with no sensation of getting tight the steel bolt just extracted aluminum thread from the body of the stem and rotated freely. i think the issue may be partially with too short bolt supplied, but, most importantly - the material of the stem is a VERY SOFT aluminum, not the appropriate required grade. BEWARE! Bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Atkin

customer_reviews.title: Great stem! Just replace bolts n go shred the trails!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try a shorter stem while my raceface stem was getting warranty repair and it's still on my mtb even after getting my raceface back I liked it that much. Great quality, only problem are the bolts. The heads seem to strip easily. $2 at home depot for 6 new stronger bolts n problem solved. Trail tested n all good.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the capscrews are tight.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I needed the shortest stem possible for a Fuji Gran Fondo that I own and this seemed to fit that requirement. I found this stem to be well made and certainly very strong although it is alittle heavy for those who are weight conscious. The reason that I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 is: it has no knurling or grooves to prevent slick handlebars from slipping. You have to cinch down the cap screws tighter than what you would think is necessary. After arriving at that conclusion I have had no problem with slipping handlebars. Overall I think this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack H. Linn

customer_reviews.title: Use screws from other stem if you can and tighten them down good
customer_reviews.text: Seeing other comments about the screws stripping I used the factory ones that came with my bike. Second one went a lot faster for me to install after learning to keep the fork tight against head tube. I thought I got them right enough around the fork but took a pretty good fall and it twisted a little so my wheel was not inline with my handle bars. Just make sure to get them right enough and this should not happen. I'm happy so far! A cheap way to test out if I like the shorter stem and the quality seems good enough it'll last me a while.
customer_reviews.author: andy hough

customer_reviews.title: Thank you to all the reviewers before me who wrote such good things. Now that I've bought one, they were all true.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love well-built things, when the finish and craftsmanship is precise. This stem fits that bill. Machining is great all around the edges. Consistent anodizing. Bolts are good quality. Threading is clean. Fits perfectly onto the stem and bars. The colour is not flashy but rather very elegant and strong. Just wish I could build another bike so that I can buy another one in a different colour, but my wife would not be so happy with "another bike!" in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. in Toronto

customer_reviews.title: Short stack so be aware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stem for my son’s MTB. Overall I’m pleased with the purchase, timely delivery, and the product itself. The one downside I did find was that this is a shorter stack height than many other similar stems. I’ve found most stems to be 40-50mm for a stack height on the steer tube where this one is only 30mm. If you plan on purchasing this make sure you either want to cut your steer tube down or have a 10mm spacer handy. Other than that the product is great. Light-weight. Great color. Seems like decent construction so far. I’ll update after a few trail rides if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: The Beachbum Medic

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight. Too much so...
customer_reviews.text: I don't trust this stem so it now lives on my trainer bike. When I installed it on my gravel bike I could see the face plate start to deform before I torqued the bolts to spec. I also noticed some odd flex on the first ride. Immediately replaced it. Might be fine on a beer-run townie bike, but not trustworthy on something that gets ridden a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Doc1

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for, okay stem. Not for heavy riding, good for testing out a shorter stem setup.
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. Decent stem for cruising but I stripped one of the inlets pretty easily, not strong metal. The bolts aren’t the issue, things made of soft metal. Don’t trust for heavy riding (not what I am doing) but good option if you want to test out a shorter stem set up which is why I got it. Will be purchasing a better stem in the future but this will do for now. About equivalent to the cheap spring suspension I got in the front of my bike...not for heavy riding.
customer_reviews.author: JMPino Photo

customer_reviews.title: Trail bike adjustment for XC bike
customer_reviews.text: Installed this stem on my XC mountain bike to give it a little more of a trail bike feel. Didn't notice any negative effects of the shorter stem (steering didn't feel twitchy) and was able to control the bike better and get a little more air on the jumps. Definitely recommend this product for quality and lightweight aspects. And you can't beat a $10 stem and a matching set of $20 wide WAKE bars to make your older XC bike way more fun to ride!
customer_reviews.author: FreeDive

customer_reviews.title: Amazing...
customer_reviews.text: Wow,what a difference those 10 mm or so makes in handling and comfort/position, went on with ease practical installed it self,instead of a adding a stem spacer I just cut of a little bit of the fork tube with a pipe cutter,I can not find anything wrong this stem,all alloy metals break at some point,I bet this one would stand up to some heavy dirt jumping, all bolts are 4 mm and you will need the larger than normal bar diameter 38 I think, they make spacer, so if you're wondering about my duck tape spacer its temporary until I got my new bars,no doubt on this gem,I come from a bmx back ground.
customer_reviews.author: Sereny

customer_reviews.title: Great Stem, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: *** MY PHOTOS OF THIS STEM ARE A PAINTED ORANGE VARIANT AND NOT THE ORIGINAL COLOR *** The product photos supplied by the seller are spot on. I had my stem painted to match my crank set. It's lightweight, super sturdy and looks at home with carbon bars. I over-torque everything all the time and the included hardware took all my abuse no problem. Silly as it sounds, one of the best parts of this stem is how much I haven't hit my knees on it. I'm a tall dude and that can be a real issue with more block-style stem shapes. Surprised my knee caps lived past my bmx days. Overall: 2 Thumbs way up.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking stem. I purchased it to replace an old stem that was not compatible with the steerer of a new fork I'm putting on my old mountain bike. It looks good and it installed easily. The Wake stem however is not very sturdy. The stem flexes noticeably. This stem may be suitable for light duty recreational riding however I would be cautious using it for serious mountain biking.
customer_reviews.author: raj from chicagoTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the $ , also order spacers to be safe
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my gt aggressor pro, I didn’t like how long the stock stem was. Wanted the handle bars a bit closer, this stem did the job ALTHOUGH just to be safe I would order some spacers as well. I learned the hard way by ordering none with it and my stock spacers didn’t measure up so had to order some. Color is dope too it matches the colorway of my bike
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dundee

customer_reviews.title: A++, beware you may need spacers!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my Motobecane Boris Fat Bike. Great quality, perfect fit. I did have to buy additional spacers to complete the swap.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a fordable seems durable  I'm definitely not a light Rider
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure why comfort is a option but okay considering it is a stem and comfort really has nothing to do with that but with that being said it works as described it does what it's supposed to do and the gold's not too cheesy looking..... But definitely checks off the marks for mounting handlebars and bringing them closer....
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This stem looked goo,d felt good, priced good, and the Reviews were somewhat good. I bought it but my bats were too skinny for this stem. I bought spacers which worked but at the end my whole fork was moving not sure what I needed to do so I ended up returning it and getting a truvativ stem for a pretty good price, but I can guarantee the quality and safety will be better.
customer_reviews.author: R.L

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I changed my mtb stem on my Motobecane Fantom DS from a 90mm it came with to this 45mm stem. I just had to add a spacer to raise it to where I had my previous stem and it works great. My steering feels quicker and the cockpit is closer to me so I'm sitting in a more upright position. I think this stem looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Magana

customer_reviews.title: Superb item
customer_reviews.text: Construction of this stem is very good. Just installed them and finished 2am. Can’t wait for the morning to try it. I know there will be a big difference bec the stock that came with my 29er is about 5 inches long and I can feel the weight when turning the front wheel. Looks good too. I will be updating my review if I have complains after test driving it. Otherwise, superb item.
customer_reviews.author: C.Partey

customer_reviews.title: It works. Even when bombing downhill.
customer_reviews.text: Great stem for the price. Didnt have any issues installing on my 2019 Giant Teance 3. Was a bit longer than I anticipated but brought the bars back a couple inches and kept me more over the rear wheel at Snowshoe. Yes its durable. I'm 220 lbs and rode down Skyline (the jump trail) like a bat outtake hell for three laps and did some tech stuff too and it lasted just fine
customer_reviews.author: Josh E

customer_reviews.title: I ride more comfortably now. Must be working!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I gotta say this changed my riding posture for the better. I sit more upright, my bike's handling is tighter, and now I really want bars that are just a bit wider! Make sure you have some spacers on hand, especially with the GT aggressor pro though I think that's one of those things that goes without saying.
customer_reviews.author: WanderingSpirit

customer_reviews.title: Great stem, completely updates the look of a cheap bike.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap $119 huffy MTB a month ago, I had immediate issues with the stock quill stem. The handlebars would twist while I was riding, no matter how much I tightened the stem bolt. This stem made for a huge difference, paired with an UPANBIKE stem adapter and handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: B Wright

customer_reviews.title: Bring your toolkit...
customer_reviews.text: I mostly ride enduro/tech trail in the mid west. After installing this stem, my bars loosened up after ~4 miles. Even after adding thread-locker, I still get the sense that the bars slip occasionally. This was an affordable way to experiment with stem length, but I don't trust it enough to leave it on my bike long term.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive replacement to my son's bicycle steering stem
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, looks good on the bicycle. I purchased this to replace the MTB steering stem on my son's bike. The oem was a tad bit long, so I wanted him to be more comfortable and confident when he rides. It's not as high quality to what I'm used to, but this is a good, inexpensive replacement for it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha De Castro-Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: Good budget stem for my little boy’s new mountain bike. The finish up close on the week bars or stem is not great. But who cares. $10 shipped vs 5-20x more for a stem made this an easy decision. Seems to be as durable as any stem and the number of positive reviews did not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Earley

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly strong
customer_reviews.text: I am 275 pounds, and this stem held up no problem on my single speed rigid drop bar mountain bike build. Super strong, super good value, and cool looking!
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, light weight, attractive, just what I needed. The only reason this isn’t 5 stars is I had to order two. The first had a faulty threaded hole into which I could not fully tighten the bolt. However at this price point, I just ordered a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Cunningman23

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal on a great stem!
customer_reviews.text: This stem was so good for $10 that I completely don't understand why there are stems very similar to it selling for 10x the price. I definitely like riding a great quality bike, but I still can't wrap my head around the idea of spending $5000 or more on any bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little stem. Feels very light and looks tough. Fits good too. Can't comment on the strength or durability yet. Ill update if I end up with a sucking chest wound... I have one on my gravel bike, fat bike and both kids mountain bikes. Nice and short so it brings the hands closer to the body
customer_reviews.author: boilerman

customer_reviews.title: Great value and function
customer_reviews.text: Why pay over $30 for name brand stuff when this thing is solid and functional? put it on my carbon HB's because i needed to replace the stock 90mm stem with something shorter. Be aware that you may need to purchase some spacers to make everything fit but those are about $6. Looks great and is really solid. I"ve got about 100 mi on it so far and no issues. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been on the trails with it yet. I'll update my review after a few rides. It doesn't look bad at all for the price. The machining wasn't terrible either but not as pretty as a more high end piece. I put this on my old bike as an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is good. Install was easy. We used a torque wrench and had no issues with the included bolts. Its now been on a few trail rides and one really good crash with no issues at all. I would buy it again and would recommend it to someone that wants a good deal on a short stem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: When buying this you'll maybe need to add a headset spacer. Depending on your previous set up but keep this in mind. The stem isn't so glossy as I thought which I find perfect. it's very light. Don't know how strong the material is and if it'll endure rough use. But for moderate use it's definitely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Burny

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The stem is very short, which as a cheap upgrade is just what I needed to replace a super long one. One note, you will need new headset spacers or to cut down your fork tube to fit it in most cases as it is not very tall on the headtube clamp side.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally bought a 45mm riser handlebar looking for the cheapest deal on amazon but it didn't fit my old stem so ended up getting this. This stem so far seems solid, nothing special but good value. I could do without the "best bicycle" text though...
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure your bars!
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to measure my bars before buying this and it didn’t end well. When the stem arrived, I attempted to install it only to find it was way to big for my bars. NOTE TO ALL READERS: Measure your bars before buying this or any other stem. If you’re buying a new set of bars with the new stem, be sure that the dimensions are correct so you don’t end up with the same problem I did. I will add a more full review once I have ordered new bars and used them with the stem.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Good product, love the anodized colors
customer_reviews.text: No issues upon inspection or installation, all pinch bolts threaded perfectly and was able to withstand 6nm torque with no signs of cross threading or stripping. Highly recommend to add a drop of blue Loctite to each bolt before torquing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Bling Bling
customer_reviews.text: Very cool short stem that adds a little “bling” to your bike. Update: I have hardly ridden my bike after installing this (maybe five times in the last year) noticed the gold coloring is coming off and making my bars look brown. Subtracted a star for that but otherwise its still doing alright.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Mos

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Going to test this out tomorrow. So far it looks good, seems to be decent quality and lightweight. And if you have a store bought bike, you will need handle bar and headset risers to use this. Or just get different, better handlebars to match it, but will still need headset riser rings.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price on it. It looks and feels great and definitely a good upgrade for the price. I have only done a little riding, but has so far help up great. This stem was however not quite as wide as my previous stem, so I had to get some headset spacers to make everything for correctly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chyelin

customer_reviews.title: Light stiff high quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how far ahead Asian bike industry is today. Incredibly good stem for the money, Was skeptical , based on the great price. This stem is as good as it could be. Sure it's not ''zero gap'' design , but it works just fine, it is lite, stiff and reminds me Funn brand. Took it straight to Keystone Colorado and it performed flawlessly. 10 years ago stem this good could have being 6 times more expensive. May be I scored good batch, may be not. Couldn't be any happier. Price is worth it even for fit and size experimentation. An eye candy to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Max from Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a non-standard headset on a 20 y. o ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a non-standard headset on a 20 y.o. MTB. It is a remarkably well-mannered component, regardless of the price, which is unbelievably low.
customer_reviews.author: shortTimer

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Probably too short for my needs but it serves its purpose as a 45mm stem. No issues and already survived a crash. The "Best Bicycle" covers up nicely with a Sharpie as well ;) Will probably retire it soon since 45 mm is just too twitchy and terrible for climbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace and older two bolt stem that was too long for my taste, this has worked well for me, I haven’t stripped anything out like other reviewers but I also wasn’t using a lot of force to tighten down the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: This piece is for a larger-diameter handlebar not a standard diameter
customer_reviews.text: This piece looks very nice, it's fit the stem of my Fork very nicely, but the clamp that holds the handlebars is oversized, and so I had to wrap a strap of leather around my handlebars, in order for them to be mounted securely. I was not happy about that. But it's working so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: S.J.Bokor

customer_reviews.title: Great for the value.
customer_reviews.text: This stem was a direct replacement for my Schwinn Boundary 29er. Cant beat it for the price, Looks and feels great. plus the green matches the accents of the bike very well. Haven't tested on any trails yet, so I don't know how well it will hold up but I will update my review once I properly test it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cox

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but I knew that. Solid built and functional.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a much shorter stem. About 60 grams heavier than the long stem I have but I didn't want to spend more money to just try. Good price and seems solidly built including the finish. I might just keep it installed on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Island Capture

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This stem was not much money so I wasn't expecting too much, but when I received it I was impressed with the quality. It is not the lightest, but I is certainly durable. Perfect fit to the handlebar and the steerer tube.
customer_reviews.author: zinalia martel

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great modern stem, especially for the price. I don't think I would use it for freestyle or extreme downhill riding, just because of the pricepoint, but for everyday riding and moderate trails the stem has been performing great. Will update if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck. Heavy compared to ritchey stem.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price Heavier than my stock stem that is twice as large. Made my bike more comfortable to ride. Only rode for 2 miles on a test ride. Will commute 20 miles to work tomorrow. If stem has issues, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: bryan archuleta

customer_reviews.title: nice accessory
customer_reviews.text: needed yellow to accent my bike at first they did'nt fit so i bought spacers they should of included them my handlebars were 25.4 cm they sent me 31 my bad,my fault nice fitting , i also bought stem extender of the same color now my handlebars are real uprizing...
customer_reviews.author: Amamagoozon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a proper short stem for your mountain bike? Well, this is a pretty nice budget stem. Maybe not a schnazzy as my Renthal, but just as functional. Hard to figure a good reason to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrebyter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price and awesome quality.
customer_reviews.text: You can't argue with this stem. The price and build quality is great. The stems that look exactly the same, but cost 5 times more are a joke. WAKE up, and buy this one. You can call it a win.
customer_reviews.author: MightyDragon

customer_reviews.title: The bike is so much more responsive and comfortable you ride
customer_reviews.text: Not A MTB expert but I know what feels right. I desired out my longer stern for this one and immediately felt so much more in control on the trails that I ride. These trails have a lot of tight cut backs and steep drops. The bike is so much more responsive and comfortable you ride.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This stem did exactly what it's supposed to do. It came on time, was easy to install and looks great on my bike. I love the color. It was a perfect match for the blue accents on my bike. And a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great value and well built
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my new project bike. The stem was well machined and anodizing was good. I used a torque wrench (5nm) to tighten all bolts without any issues or problems. 5nm is tight enough to hold the bar as well keep the stem secured on the steerer for normal riding.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy A.

customer_reviews.title: Color is not green
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a green stem to match my bike build. There is only a faint hint of green to this piece. It's more like a yellowish gold. However, the stem would have worked otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should, weighs a lot
customer_reviews.text: It fit no problem, though I did have to add a couple headset spacers because the clamp is shorter compared to my original stem. The only real downside to this stem is weight. It's quite heavy!
customer_reviews.author: MrRifleman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Looks well made. I read some of the reviews on how it breaks when over tightening so I just make sure to torque it right. I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: REGGieANNeSD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Young grandson is very tough on bike components, handle bars, grips, etc. When we replaced the handle bars with the larger diameter, higher strength, competition type bars we needed to change the front fork stem. This stem is much stronger, lightweight, and fits perfectly! Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Howie W.nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels much higher end.
customer_reviews.text: Building up a Klunker/MTB single speed. Didn't want to spend a ton on parts but I wanted it nice. This Stem exceded my expectations for the money. Seems solid and definitely looks like a part multiples of the tiny price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Kim & Joan

customer_reviews.title: Useless. Might as well burn the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bad. The quality of “best sellers” on amazon is just generally crap. It’s been on steady decline for years. Oh consumerism. Anyways, this bike stem is terrible. Bolts stripped inside on first use. Completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 2018 Fuji Adventure hard tail bike. I need a extra spacer but this should go well with the new 720mm bar I ordered. Will update soon and talk about the feel and flaws. Build quality is nice, comes with the 6 screws needed to bolt this baby on to your stem. I'm switching over from my stock riser because I'm tired if extending my arms far forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made but I had to return
customer_reviews.text: Bought this without measuring and revived it its made good but way to low for me comfort on my bike. Had to return it and bought the adjustable wake stem
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality but wont fit my Beach Cruiser
customer_reviews.text: This is very study and will definitely hold some handlebars down which is why I bought it. BUT i was wrong with the setup of how it is and wont fit my beach cruiser which is probably entirely my fault anyways. But I have it for my next motorized bicycle build and itll look awesome and almost 100% it'll exceed that and do its job! Good Buy all and all
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Stem
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my bike. Allowed me to bring the bar closer for a more comfortable ride.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Good find
customer_reviews.text: Nice light-weight stem (45mm) for a mountain bike. I forgot to weigh it , but definitely larger than the 90mm stock unit. Went for a few hard trail rides and held up fine so far. Excellent for the price, so far.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelMax

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction. Returned it right away.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to fit Okay, but way too flimsy, and the hardware was low quality. May work for easy cruising around town, but I wouldn't trust it on the trail. I returned it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Gpzguy

customer_reviews.title: Inspect your items
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this stem and some handle bars and one of them is bent or crooked because after installing my left shoulder and neck started hurting bad and after looking closer it's bent on the right side. Horrible shoulder pain should be sueing
customer_reviews.author: BE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install on my Giant Mtb. Made handling alot tighter and looks pretty good Make sure you triple check you have tightened the bolts all the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality except the bolts rust quickly. Shortened up my front end enough to get me doing bunny-hops!
customer_reviews.author: YankeeBravo

customer_reviews.title: Good part, just make sure you measure your old stem
customer_reviews.text: Nice stem, clean look, metal screws are a bit soft (started to strip after tightening. Just make sure you measure your old stem because I had to order headset spacers to get these to fit.
customer_reviews.author: CMojica

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive stem. Works perfectly and 4 bokts is noticeably more secure and stuff than the 2 bold bar clamp that came with my bike.
customer_reviews.author: UncleDanDan

customer_reviews.title: Great light-weight shorty stem.
customer_reviews.text: WAKE products are notoriously hot or miss, this one seems to be a hit! Not a downhill stem. But if your bike is too big for you this might help
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look nice and feels it can hold the punishment
customer_reviews.text: They were nice, looks and feels that they are made from strong alluminum, and the details are sportier but it does not fit my bike so i return it
customer_reviews.author: alex neblasca jr

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Installs with no issues, looks pretty good. Its not expensive and seems to work well. I would use again. Zero issues
customer_reviews.author: Zaniix

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used gravel bike that was a little to large for my preference, so I decided to get a shorter stem. I was concerned about this part because of the low price, but it has held up well. It looks out of place and cheap compared to the other parts on my Giant, but it costs a quarter of the price of the “nice” ones and holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Fink

customer_reviews.title: Great stem
customer_reviews.text: Great stem. The shorter stem made my biking position much more comfortable. I also had to buy more stem spacer to replace the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Weight, Durability, Price Pick 2
customer_reviews.text: Weight, Durability, Price Pick 2, With this stem you have all 3. Its lightweight, durable, and at a low price. I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pagay

customer_reviews.title: Will buy a third set if needed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Wake stem. So far both are holding up good. My boy installed it on his DJ and he said the bike feels good. The stem did bring up the bars just a bit so it saves me money from buying a rise bars
customer_reviews.author: Chavs

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decently made and the right length for our application
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decently made and the right length for our application. I wouldn't go using it on a dirt jumper but for my 10 year old's mountain bike it's just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Handlebar closer as I needed
customer_reviews.text: Not the lightest, but certainly gave me what I was after which is getting my handlebar closer to my seat. Will buy another one if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sol322

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 2015 specialized enduro. Seems pretty tough. Nice and short and gives a slight rise. I use the bike for enduro type riding.
customer_reviews.author: Noah J. Priegel

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: i Was a bit iffy about the stem cause it was o le 10 bucks, but hey I still gave it a shot. No problems whatsoever and I’ve been on a good amount of rides, and some were gnarly! I was reading that people were stripping the screws but everything was fine, just do it properly and you won’t have a problem. Other than that, product has been holding up well and doing its job, and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Josue Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great stem
customer_reviews.text: Great stem. Perfect for shortening the reach and made my old XC bike feel way more aggressive with wider wake bars as well
customer_reviews.author: fullplate

customer_reviews.title: To light weight for trail use!
customer_reviews.text: This stem is fine if all you're going to do is bike around the neighbor hood. Don't take it on any trails. Really thin! 4mm Alan bolts. It's smaller than it looks in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Van Handel

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking neck
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly, looks very nice and of good quality. Only one problem is I did not measure or read correctly and it is the wrong size for my handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but at this price range is a great deal
customer_reviews.text: The stem is heavy compared to stems of the same size of other more expensive brands, but at this price tag is a good deal. I have been riding my MTB for 3 months using this stem and I can not complain. It does the job!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: The stem looks great in person but is heavy for it's size but no big deal when it's priced so cheap. I bought it for my son's bike to for the short size. Make the bike fit him a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase for another project bike because I was impressed with the quality and durability of the first one. Item was out of stock for a while, hot item. But once it was available I ordered it and arrived on a timely manner. Good value and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Good Part!
customer_reviews.text: Solid part. Looks sharp and firm fit. Does the trick of shortening reach and increasing aggressive angle.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Terrible color!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd. Set I've purchased. First the black set, then the red set and now the blue. When I say set I am referring to both the stem and handlebars. As you can see in the picture the blue stem is nowhere near the color blue as avertised. Of course I've reached out to the seller, but no solution has been given.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Seems strong and well made. Maybe not the lightest piece of kit, but a good price and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: xdpsn

customer_reviews.title: Light and Simple and Does the Job...
customer_reviews.text: In trying to fit a 12" framed bike to my 8.5 year-old daughter I thought her stretched out a bit too much...this corrected that issue and got her in a bit better position. It's light and simple and does the job...
customer_reviews.author: Kent Runge

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: Fit great 👍 Did have to check threads before I installed because of the other reviews but all was great
customer_reviews.author: Cesar franco

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my exiting Trek MTB stem with this one. I am now more upright and this helps Minimize back pain from leaning forward.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Iannotti

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Had to take it to my local bike shop to get the proper spacer, which is not surprising. Excellent value and it looks really cool. Works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: 31.8 Stem 45mm Bike Stem Wake Mountain Bike Stem Short Handlebar Stem for Most Bicycle, Road Bike, MTB, BMX, Fixie Gear, Cycling (Aluminum Alloy, Black Blue Gold Red)
product_meta.description:
Feature:
Handlebar center diameter:31.8mm (1-1/4")

Stereer tube diameter:28.6mm (1-1/8")

Length:45mm

Weight:130g

Size:31.8*28.6*45mm

Color: Black Blue Gold Red

Style:high intensity stem

Material:Aluminum alloy AL6061 T6

Package Include:
1*Bike Stem
feature_bullets: Stereer Tube diameter: 28.6mm (1-1/8"), Handlebar diameter: 31.8mm (1-1/4"), Length: 45mm, Weight: 130g
Four bolt bar clamp holds bar securely in position.
Easy installation, just connect up the original front fork stem.
Universal short handle bar stem suitable for most road bike, fixed gear bicycle, mountain bikes, etc
